items.description: AcknowledgeBusinessCommunicationEvents

messageId.description: Globally unique message ID (unique in space and time to avoid incident management and problem management issues)

correlationId.description: Relevant in request and response scenarios: request message optional fieldl; can hold patent message ID in case of event; response message mandatory field: has the messageID of the request.

conversationId.description: the conversationID is carried forward from incoming to outgoing message and must be the same for all messages, except in case of an event, where the event recipient always starts a new coversation ID

sequenceNumber.description: Should the message be part of a sequence of messages, then this field is used to indicate in which sequence the message was emitted. Each individual event type can use it's own counter.

dateTimeCreated.description: date and time of when the event happened. If this was not an event then pass when the message was created, in UTC notation!

COMMONTRANV1_TransactionType.description: Contains transaction data as per the standard. Copy MessageID in CorrelationID in all replies, and carry forward ConversationIDs as per the standard.

majorVersion.description: Major Service API Contract/Interface version. Not related to the implementation of the service. Use numeric integer values only. Only change the major version in case of an incompatible contract change.

minorVersion.description: Minor Service API version . Not related to the implementation of the service. Use numeric integer values only. Only change the  minor version number in case of a compatible contract change. In case of a major version change, the minor version changes to 0.

contractVersion.description: Versioning information for the Contract/Interface of the API only. Does not hold ANY implementation information of the service provider.

build.description: Identifier for the build of the service provider. Could be numeric or alphanumeric.

businessTransactionId.description: Unique message ID (unique in context of the consumer to avoid incident management and problem management issues) of the business transaction leading to this message. Is used to facilitate for idempotency and incident and problem management.

dateTimeCreated.description: businessTransactionCreated timestamp in Zulu notation (so UTC)

COMMONCTV1_ConsumerTransactionType.description: Contains common metadata, transaction information from the consumer of the API.

Flv000484_V1_S_4xXEeJ_CodeValueType.description: A code value is exactly one symbol in a coding system. This is also known as reference data. The value is implemented in a specific context (eg. application) A single CodeValue type can have different implemented values over different contexts. The master list of values is defined in the context "BEIM" whereas alternate values can be defined in an application specific context. example: use of CV type for LanguageType as reference data. - standard reference data values (context = "BEIM") defined for LanguageType are: NL,FR,EN,DE - assume LanguageType implemented in application XYZ: 1,2,3,4 - assume LanguageType implemented in application ABC: NL,FR,EN,DE CV would be used as follows: codeSystem: LanguageType codeSystemVersion 1.0 codeDescr "classification of languages" value: "NL" context: "BEIM" -- or -- codeSystem: LanguageType codeSystemVersion 1.0 codeDescr "classification of languages" value: "1" context: "XYZ"Type used on response message of operation pullbusinesscommunicationcreated

Flv000484_V1_S_3fOskC_StatisticalSectorT.description: The smallest territorial unit, created by the Belgian National Geographic Institute (NIS), for which socio-economical statistics are made. NIS Code : De eerste vijf posities. Deze komen overeen met de NIS-gemeentecode. De zesde positie. Met deze letter wordt gewoonlijk de gemeente vóór de fusie aangeduid, ook soms een samenvoeging van voormalige gemeenten. Ook kan weleens een letter zijn toegekend aan een kadastrale indeling of aan een onderverdeling van een grote stad. De zevende positie. Dit is een cijfer dat slaat op de wijk. Het cijfer komt meestal overeen met de wijk anno 1970. De achtste positie. Dit cijfer geeft gewoonlijk het ruimere type van bodemgebruik aan (0 tot 5: aaneengesloten bebouwing, 8 en 9: verspreide bebouwing, 7: bedrijvenzone, 6: woonpark met recreatiedoeleinde). Als er veel sectoren waren, en dus niet genoeg cijfers, is weleens van die regel afgeweken. Zo kon het bijv. voorkomen dat een sector met bedrijfsfunctie een ander cijfer toegekend kreeg. De negende positie. Een cijfer of een bindstreepje waarmee wordt aangeduid het type wijziging dat t.o.v. de sector uit 1970 is aangebracht. Een streepje wijst erop dat de statistische sector ongewijzigd is gebleven. Het cijfer 0 kenmerkt statistische sectoren waarvan de vorm lichtjes werd aangepast. Sectoren ontstaan uit de opsplitsing van een statistische sector uit 1970 krijgen een cijfer van 1 tot 8. Het cijfer 9 wordt gebruikt voor statistische sectoren voortgekomen uit de samenvoeging van sectoren uit 1970. Fictieve sectoren. Om bijzondere situaties op te vangen zijn een aantal fictieve sectoren aangemaakt. Zulke sectoren staan niet op de kaarten van de statistische sectoren weergegeven. Ze komen enkel in de statistische tabellen te voorschijn. Code Z97- (voorOnbekende sector”) was voorbehouden aan inwoners van wie wegens ontoereikende informatie niet kon worden achterhaald tot welke statistische sector ze behoren. Code Z982 was bestemd voor rondtrekkende of –reizende personen, zoals binnenschippers. Code Z991 werd gebruikt voor tijdelijk afwezige personen, zoals in Duitsland verblijvende militairen en in het buitenland gestationeerde Belgische diplomaten. http://statbel.fgov.be/nl/statistieken/opendata/datasets/tools/big/SH_STAT_SECTORS.jspType used on response message of operation pullbusinesscommunicationevents

Flv000484_V1_S_3fOskC_GeographicAddressT.description: A reference to a Place described via one or more coordinate systems and/or a structured textual way based on House Number, Street, Municipality, and Country.Ex. Koning Albert 2 laan 27, 1030 Brussel, België; GPS coördinates: 50.860234, 4.357754A GeographicAddress is created in the context of a single Addessable Object (eg. Builing, network resource,...)example For a residential house (Building) on which an network resource (eg. sensor) is attached,2 GeographicAddresses will be created: one for the Building and one for the network resource each with its specific context.The context for which the GeographicAddress is created will determine whether the GeographicAddress is official or unofficial and how and where it can be used.Example: 1/ a GeographicAddress created in the context of a Building is an official address which can be used to send postal mail, billing documents,...2/ a GeographicAddress created in the context of a network resource is an unofficial address which can be used to send a technician to.Type used on response message of operation pullbusinesscommunicationevents

Flv000484_V1_S_08ktbb_CodeValueType.description: A code value is exactly one symbol in a coding system. This is also known as reference data. The value is implemented in a specific context (eg. application) A single CodeValue type can have different implemented values over different contexts. The master list of values is defined in the context "BEIM" whereas alternate values can be defined in an application specific context. example: use of CV type for LanguageType as reference data. - standard reference data values (context = "BEIM") defined for LanguageType are: NL,FR,EN,DE - assume LanguageType implemented in application XYZ: 1,2,3,4 - assume LanguageType implemented in application ABC: NL,FR,EN,DE CV would be used as follows: codeSystem: LanguageType codeSystemVersion 1.0 codeDescr "classification of languages" value: "NL" context: "BEIM" -- or -- codeSystem: LanguageType codeSystemVersion 1.0 codeDescr "classification of languages" value: "1" context: "XYZ"Type used on response message of operation pullbusinesscommunicationupdated

Flv000484_V1_S_3IWv4l_CodeValueType.description: A code value is exactly one symbol in a coding system. This is also known as reference data. The value is implemented in a specific context (eg. application) A single CodeValue type can have different implemented values over different contexts. The master list of values is defined in the context "BEIM" whereas alternate values can be defined in an application specific context. example: use of CV type for LanguageType as reference data. - standard reference data values (context = "BEIM") defined for LanguageType are: NL,FR,EN,DE - assume LanguageType implemented in application XYZ: 1,2,3,4 - assume LanguageType implemented in application ABC: NL,FR,EN,DE CV would be used as follows: codeSystem: LanguageType codeSystemVersion 1.0 codeDescr "classification of languages" value: "NL" context: "BEIM" -- or -- codeSystem: LanguageType codeSystemVersion 1.0 codeDescr "classification of languages" value: "1" context: "XYZ"Type used on response message of operation pullbusinesscommunicationdeleted
